Description: Double-reed (?) pipe: with three holes which have been burnt into the instrument and are unevenly spaced. The pipe bends slightly at a node between the mouthpiece end and the first hole. The bore is cylindrical and varies considerably.
Curator's comments: J. G. Wilkinson, ‘The Manners and Customs of the Ancient Egyptians’ (1878), i, p. 486, woodcut no. 251,2.
